etymology.description: Phonetic: 尚(尚) (shàng, "esteem") + Semantic: 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") -> 向(向) (xiàng, "towards") represents a house -> 堂(táng, "hall")
etymology.interpretation: The character 堂(táng) combines the phonetic component 尚(shàng), which hints at pronunciation, with the semantic 土(tǔ) for earth, relating to a building or structure. 向(xiàng) provides the sense of a house, reinforcing the meaning of 'hall' or 'central room'.

examples.chinese: 他踏入正堂参拜祖先(他踏入正堂參拜祖先)。
examples.pinyin: Tā tà rù zhèng táng cān bài zǔ xiān.
examples.english: He stepped into the main hall to pay respects to his ancestors.

examples.chinese: 家庭聚会在大堂举行(家庭聚會在大堂舉行)，传递家族荣誉(傳遞家族榮譽)。
examples.pinyin: Jiātíng jùhuì zài dà táng jǔxíng, chuándì jiāzú róngyù.
examples.english: Family gatherings are held in the great hall, passing on the family's honor.
